discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The change management process is the correct answer because it ensures that any changes to the network, such as updating the STP (Spanning Tree Protocol) port cost, are reviewed, approved, documented, and communicated to all relevant stakeholders. This process minimizes the risk of unintended disruptions or negative impacts on the network and ensures that all changes are aligned with business objectives.

A. Business continuity focuses on keeping the business operational during and after disruptions, not on approving network changes.

B. Disaster recovery is related to restoring systems and data after a disaster, not optimizing or changing the network configuration.

C. Incident response deals with managing and mitigating security incidents or breaches, not planned network optimizations.

questions.question_text: A network engineer performed a detailed network analysis. The engineer has decided to update the STP port cost in order to optimize the network. Which of the following processes should the engineer use to gain approval for the network optimization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The workstation was likely connected to a hub, which operates at half-duplex by design. Hubs share bandwidth among all connected devices, meaning they can only send or receive data at a time (half-duplex), not both simultaneously (full-duplex). This explains why the workstation was not connected at full duplex.

A. Media converter simply converts media types (e.g., fiber to copper) and doesn't affect duplex settings.
C. Bridge operates more intelligently and typically supports full-duplex communication.
D. Layer 3 switch operates at higher efficiency and supports full-duplex on all ports.

questions.question_text: A network technician plugged a workstation in to a network device. When the technician turned on the workstation, it was not connected at full duplex. Which of the following devices was the workstation connected to?
A user is trying to map a network fileshare to a local drive and needs to open a firewall port for this traffic. Which of the following ports needs to be opened to accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Port 445 is used for SMB (Server Message Block), which is the protocol that allows file sharing over a network. When mapping a network file share to a local drive, SMB traffic flows over TCP port 445, so this port needs to be opened in the firewall.

A. 389 is used for LDAP.
C. 514 is used for syslog.
D. 636 is used for LDAPS (LDAP over SSL).

Selected Answer: C
ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) operates at the Network layer (Layer 3) of the OSI model. It is primarily used for sending error messages and operational information, such as with the ping and traceroute commands.

A. Application (Layer 7) handles user interaction.
B. Session (Layer 5) manages sessions between applications.
D. Transport (Layer 4) is responsible for end-to-end communication (e.g., TCP/UDP).
C. Network layer. ICMP is used for network diagnostics and error reporting

questions.question_text: Which of the following OSI layers is ICMP a part of?
After the A record of a public website was updated, some visitors were unable to access the website. Which of the following should be adjusted to address the issue?

discussion.content:
When a client gets a DNS reply from a query, it will store it locally (cached) for a period
of time to reduce the number of lookups on the DNS servers. In each DNS reply there is a
field called TTL, or time to live. This instructs the client how long to store the replay before
requesting again. This allows us to reduce the network workload and keep the DNS data
fresh on the client. All devices use a cache system that stores the requests locally for a period
of time and the time to live (TTL) value tells the client how long that should be.

Selected Answer: A
TTL (Time to Live) should be adjusted to address the issue. The TTL determines the amount of time a record remains cached on a DNS server before it is considered expired and must be retrieved again. If the TTL is set too low, it can result in visitors being unable to access the website because they are accessing a cached, outdated version of the DNS record.

Fun fact to make this question confusing. The SOA has a serial number that sometimes needs to be manually updated so the devices that are accessing it know that they need to update their cache. So if you reduce your TTL, the cache will take less time to be updated, but updating the serial number will instantly tell the devices trying to access it that their cache data needs to be updated. 
Even though this may be the case, the answer is still A. TTL but hey, the more you know.

Selected Answer: A
TTL determines the amount of time a record remains cached on a DNS server. The user could be trying to access the old cache data that no longer leads to the correct location.
